review: This place is a good spot for a beautiful valley view. We saw some cottages available as well. The place is well connected and peaceful.

title: Must visit
review: Located at very good height from where you can see some picturesque view of enchanting Himalayas from this place.

title: Close to nature
review: One can get a clear view of peaks of Himalaya...narrow roads to reach at the top makes the ride thrilling...

title: Nice View
review: It is probably the highest pick of lansdowne....Nice view from the top. GMVN resort was there.Very quite and calm place.You will find one small shop for soft drinks and for some snacks. GMVN restaurant also was there.It is near the main market and top of the Bhular lake.

title: SUNSET POINT
review: A great point to watch Sunset!Located next to GMVN HUTS!We enjoyed spending the evening here!From this point one can look at the beautiful hills surrounding Lansdowne!

title: great views
review: the panoramic views are good the drawback is lack of toilet facilities and the litter thrown around. the resposible people must take pride in keeping the area clean

title: Best Sunrise point in Lansdown
review: This place is a gem! I would suggest to visit it in morning to enjoy the cool weather and great sunrise if there is no cloud cover. Else you can go there any time of the day and enjoy some nice time.

title: Peace and quiet!
review: As one winds through the hills of Lansdowne, Tip in top point emerges and offers a beautiful view of the ranges around. The best time to visit this is around October they say, as the mist is much less and the point offers a panoramic view of the Himalayas!

title: A high point
review: i was told that the place has great views.. But its just normal. I felt I had even better view from my hotel. This is just one more attraction spot in Lansdowne. an spend some time peacefully looking at the hills.

title: Nice view
review: The place, probably the highest point in Lansdowne, offers scenic views of the valley. It can be much more well maintained by the authorities though.

title: Small place
review: Nothing much to do here, it's just like a see and roam point at the top of the mountain. Good for taking pictures and enjoy the location

title: Woww view of Sunrise...!!
review: One of the highest point in Lansdowne from where u can watch sunrise.

title: It is also called Tiffin Top
review: Perhaps the Tip-in-Top got corrupted too Tiffin Top. We began our trek around 5.15 a.m. in the hope to watch the sunrise. But as luck would have it, the sky was overcast and after the 40 minutes climb to the 4 k.m. (approx) top, we were greeted by strong, chilly and very noisy winds.  The view of the valley is indeed very beautiful. On our trek down, it rained leaving us even colder.

title: Terrible.
review: Nothing special. Its doesn't have any good views of the valley. I would rather suggest to go for Tarakshwar or Bhairav temple trek.

title: Mornings and evenings may be better
review: Day time in May isn't very pleasant, it was sunny and almost hot, so we could not enjoy this point much. The view of the valley is good, but couldn't get a view of himalayas. May be staying at the Tip & Toe would give a better idea.

title: Highest Point of Lansdowne
review: Tip-in-Top Point is the highest spot of Lansdowne. You can see unobstructed views of the valley from there. When there is no fog you can see snow covered peaks in the distance. There is a small store also nearby to purchase soft drinks and snacks.

title: NIce view
review: Very good view of sun rise and set.

title: Panoramic view from this spot
review: Once gets a good panoramic view of the mountains from this spot. Definitely seems over hyped as not much to see around in Landsdowne, as we found another good spot 1-2 kms ahead to view the sunset. If I remember correctly this spot is not wheelchair friendly and the steps were pretty high and uneven.

title: just okay type
review: boundary is made by log,and there is enough gap between the log.so it is not safe for childrens.view from the point is awsome.

title: Great place to visit
review: It is a great place to have a top down view of full lans downe. Not very far off from Lans castle hotel. The only negative is that there is no good restaurant/ place where you can get tea. The nearest cafe is quite shabby and does not serve team around lunch time.

title: Excellent
review: The panoramic view of the Himalayas and the valley , its so memorizing .. Place is so peaceful and relaxing

title: Good location
review: Nice view of the location...entire valley is visible from there.. lovely in rainy season.. Peaceful location..

title: Good view off the cliff
review: It has excellent location advantage. however keeping the area clean and maintained should improve on priority.

title: Super View from this point.
review: Good view is available from this point. Since you don't have much activities in Lansdowne , thus this place is must to visit. It will take approx. 30 minutes to reach this place from Lansdowne market.

title: Nice view point
review: Nice view point. Gives you a good view of the towns and the greens, but nothing much to do. Considering that Lansdowne does not have many places to cover, one can still visit this point.

title: Great Views
review: This is the photo spot noone misses in Lansdowne. Offers some great views of the valley. There are a couple of places where one can get photographs clicked. Can get crowded at times.

title: Good place to visit
review: Good place to visit. but it was around 10 Km from Lansdowne. View was very clear & good from there .awsome place to visit.

title: Viewing point
review: This is the highest point in Lansdowne. Good spot to view sunrises and sunsets from. I went a little after sunrise and the place was empty. Click the surrounding mountains and valleys. If you sit here for some time, you can also see a number of varieties of birds. If you want to grab a bite, you can go to the Holiday Cafe at the GMVN Tip N Top Tourist Rest House.

title: This is the place worth visiting
review: On a foggy day with some low clouds, this place would become amazing. Highlight of Lansdowne. Clean, well maintained.

title: Highly overrated
review: Could see the same view that our hotel balcony offered. It seemed like a waste of time and energy.

title: Amazing view
review: Highest point of lansdowne city and provides breath taking view of entire valley. You can enjoy natural beauty for hours here on a bright sunny day and can get some amazing picture if you are carrying DSLR with high zooming capacity lens :)

title: Good view but a bit overhyped
review: Good view of the valleys. You have to walk a little to get there. Nothing much to do besides taking a few photographs. No food stalls, no activities.

title: Kind of ok
review: It is just a point however it do worth a visit for person going to Lansdowne can be visited once. Best time in the morning or evening

title: Nice view of hills
review: A place from where you can see hills and mountain range. Every one would like to click a photo there. Clean and quiet place.

title: A view to mesmerized
review: It is one of the must visit spot while you r in Lansdowne. The trekking to the tip-in-top goes through dense forest which end up at a mesmerized spot from where you can actually see the Himalaya.

title: Tip in top
review: i expected to have great view from the point. Unfortunately it was not so good. A lot of construction activity was going on at the point. This is the highest point in Lansdowne town. Perhaps on a better and clearer day one should get a better view. The GMVN guest houses are also nearby. If one can stay in the GMVN guest house the stay can be more enjoyable.

title: Lovely place
review: While standing at tip and top, It was kind of believing that you are at the edge of the world.  Especially the white Himalyan range visible from the tip point.

title: Just another tourist spot
review: Go there to have a look at the snow capped mountains in the distance and be sorrounded by more tourists

title: Nice place
review: This is the highest point in Lansdowne and also a recommended view point.It has log huts managed by GMVN. The huts are luxury huts costing around 6.5k for one night for a family room but the place is not well maintained.

title: Nice place
review: Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view. Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view. Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view. Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view. Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view. Excellent view of the mountains. Complete 360 view.

title: Great view
review: As the name denotes, this is a tip jetting out on the mountains and have spectacular view. the place has been nicely developed. Would had loved spending more time, but for rains.

title: Lansdowne visit
review: We had been on a family vacation for two nights to this small cantt town in Apr15.Gandhi chowk is central place from where all attractions are at walking places,one should go there after doing advance booking for hotels located there.

title: Amazing view from the hill
review: One of the best view of nature from this point and it feels like you are out of the world. Do not forget to bring your camera.

title: It was a good experience
review: This is a very famous scenic point in Lansdowne . Considering the view from there , its ok to go . Nothing great as you can have same or even better views at other places.

title: Its Good but not Great
review: I found nothing exciting about this place as heard of, you can only view Himalaya peaks from here and that also not that clear, it was good but not great.

title: Views, air and peace
review: For proper views of the Himalayan range, it should be a clear and sunny day. Its located on a hilltop and there is complete silence barring that created by the tourists present.

title: Beautiful
review: I went to this place like 9 years ago when i ws still in school...as much as i remember this the most beautiful place in lansdowne...i was js lost in the beauty and i wanted to jump and fly all over that place..MUST VISIT!!!

title: Great View
review: Very Good View Point.. Lots of points for photography.. please get your camera and binoculars as no photographer or binoculars available..

title: Beautiful...
review: The best place to enjoy & explore the natural beauty of the mountains. I loved this place very much. I will definitely re-visit this place.

title: nice view from top
review: this place gives you a good view from the top of the hills down the valley...worth a visit for avid photographers..

title: just gud
review: was as gud and similar as any tip - in -top of any hill station , we went by car so the road wasnt too gud as some construction was going on, just a one time go

title: gr8 weekend
review: fantastic place to go,

title: An amazing view
review: No matter how much of the world you have seen, watching clouds beneath your feet never gets old. That's exactly what you see from the tip-in-top. That and a great distant-view of the snow laden Himalayas.

title: Nothing special
review: The place has uneven steps and has just been garishly renovated.

title: Awesome view
review: Good to visit.  It will be better visit if you go in a group of 5-10 people.  Nothing much to do. It is the sunrise point as well.

title: Just sit there and see
review: A small platform to sit and see the hills and jungle surrounding it. Can take small tracks down the hill but not very safe. GMVN tree houses, nearby, are good to see for those who have not seen the raw jungle houses.

title: The best site at lansdowne
review: TIP IN TOP

title: Come for the view
review: We happened to visit the place and what exactly is this place, well you can see the snow covered mountains and uncovered ones as well, the small villages and the plantations and you can miss remembering the view.

title: Old world view charms
review: Nice place, neatly kept by the army authorities and for the very reason it is.....breath taking view.....!!!

title: Great view
review: Like: the view, the location, the weather. You can have perfect picturesque view of the hills and a view of small town life style is an addition to the beauty of the  place.

title: Worth a visit
review: This is probably the highest point you can easily reach.

title: Nice view
review: This is the top of Lansdowne but there is hardly any place to sit and enjoy the beauty (apart from few benches).

title: I see you..
review: nice place to see nearly 1/3 of garhwal...its sitated near GMVN tourist bunglow and is perfect place for family outing....parking is easily available for INR 10..must visit

title: Beautiful Sunrise point
review: Do visit this point during sunrise. Sunrise is mesmerizing here. nothing much to roam arnd but this point gives u best point to scenic spots

title: Good point to visit but stay away from nearby cafe
review: The place is good and offers you a great view. The only gripe is there is not any good cafe nearby to sip a good coffee or munch onto something while resting here.

title: Beautiful
review: A most beautiful place and most beautiful view to experience. your can see only greenery and clouds till the place where your eyes reaches.

title: U Will feel On Top Of The World
review: Since we visited there during Summer, the snow view was not visible because of clouds. In Sepy/ Oct , I am told that the snow view seen from this place is just Suoerb.

title: Topmost point
review: Good place arnd 3 kms from market up towards top

title: Mesmerizing place
review: Very calm and peacful place. The view is awesome just 3 Kms from gandhi chow you can go by walk, if you enjoy long walks then prefer to go by walk in a peacful and beautiful place like lansdowne.

title: Amazing view
review: A place where you can stay for long. It offers an amazing view of the valley and beyond. Must go for anyone going to lansdowne

title: Great View!
review: A place to visit because there is not much to see in Lansdowne. The view of winding roads is very pretty esp when you see them through the fog.

title: Amazing
review: the  breath taking view n foood  and not to forget the beautiful DAHLIAS all over .. The drive to tip n top is scnenic and the place too, id service is slow in d rest but thats coz they make their food delicious n its like home made

title: Can visit
review: Point for a clear valley view. If clear sky only. We did not get good view of the vast valley as it was foggy. Army has redone the same in July 2014 only.

title: Topmost place of lansdowne
review: This is the highest and topmost place of Lansdowne. You can see  wide and panoramic view of lansdowne and its nearby places from this point.

title: At the peak
review: There is nothing much special about this Point. But a little place to check out.

title: Not much to see
review: The place is a not really at the top. All you can see from this place is the greenery of the hills. Nothing much to be seen and the place hasn't been well maintained.

title: A very average place...
review: there is nothing much to see here...but one can have snacks n tea here which is really good. just sit back and relax.enjoy good weather and mountains.

title: WALK AND SEE THE VIEW!!
review: Tip and top was on the top of lansdowne with a beautiful view but there is nothing to do at that point you just see the view and enjoy.The view of the hills and the village called jaharikhal.

title: Good view but average affair
review: It is just a point from where one can view the Himalayas and also sunset and sunrise but the view point itself is very small.

title: Needs improvement
review: This site can be a good tourist spot but lacks development needs improvement big time.View is amazing but its not being utilized by Govt. properly people needs some ey candy to get attracted to the spot and spent time

title: Amazing Point.
review: Place has surreal but nice feel. You would love to sit there for like hours and spend time in peace though there will be a saturation point for that.

title: Excellent viewpoint
review: One can have a panoramic view of the Himalayan peaks Choukhamba, Nandadevi, trishul ....

title: Good Surrounding views
review: One can get good views from here on a clear day.Nothing mentionable.There is a GMVN hotel and staying there will be good option for extensive review.

title: gives a good Himalayan range view
review: It is just like any other hill top in Uttarakhand, gives you a beautiful view of snow clayed Himalayan range.

title: Lovely view of snow clad peaks
review: I loved the view of snow clad peaks from tip and top point ..the journey from kotdwar to Lansdowne is quiet scenic with few scenic landscapes to click pictures ...Go early in morning to see snow clad peaks or if you are lucky enough you can see them in afternoon as well

title: Loved the views
review: One of the major attractions in Lansdowne with all other attractions (except Tarkeshwar) on its way. The views are magnificent like any other view points in most hill stations. You can click good pictures and get a view of snow clayed peaks if you are lucky!

title: Like any other Point up the Hills.
review: A short drive from the centre of the town takes you to the Point where the view is very good - similar to the ones at all hill stations.

title: B'ful ,peaceful & lovely hill station
review: The best time to go here is rainy season....scenic view and full of greenery. A very peaceful place and full of privacy....the cottage at the top of the hill is awesome.

title: Watching the Himalayan range was awesome
review: The view is breath taking. A great place to take some stunning pictures. The walk is a little off track but still a must visit

title: a must visit
review: You can have a great view of the valley standing on the top, what I dislike was the end point is very small

title: Hillstation
review: Tip-in-Top is a pecular hillstation point.  You can enjoy on this point provided there is no biting breeze & no bright sun.  You can see various shades of nature and a fairly good location for photography.  Since it rained during the day, we were literally in blankets, so not really enjoyed this point.

title: Average Place
review: Nothing special I can find there to see. Parking charges for car is there. It's will be great if you reach there by walking way.

title: nice sunset
review: gives a nice sunset view and beautiful place to go out with frnz and nice quality time can be spent. a small canteen nearby serves nice tea & pakoras.

title: Nice place for those in search of mental peace...
review: We visited Lansdowne from Delhi during early december 2013. very nice, clean, peaceful army based hill station.

title: Natural view point
review: Its a nice highest point in town, from here you can see great garhwal himalaya's snow covered peaks in winter and near by villages. It is  most favourite view point in between tourist.

title: Heaven on Earth......Loved it
review: I have visited Lansdowne on 29th Nov 2013 and it is a very calm and peaceful place which is very close to Nature. I stayed at Tip In Top GMVN resort. It is situate at a good height of Lansdowne and little far from crowd of city. There is no big market in Lansdowne, but this place is not known for shopping and mall road. You can see true beauty of Nature. Also Army has a good hold on overall city and all army people are very interactive. I have visited Santoshi mata mandir and St. Mary chruch which are completely take-care by Army people. Both are clean and well maintained.

title: Awesome View
review: I loved this place specially because the log cabins which garwhal  mandal vikas nigam have created.I didnt know about them but then i wished i had stayed in something like that.It is at the top where all the small mountains are visible.Probably next time

title: Serene Hill Station
review: I was here along with my family in Nov13. We chose this station due to its proximity to Delhi just 260km. This is a complete silence place. We stayed in Blue pine Resort (4km before Lansdowne). This station is not much popular among visitors & that is why it is complete serene place. For drivers it is a heaven as you will not find much traffic, honking like in Mussorie or Nanital. Driving in these hills is a pleasure, one can enjoy the beauty of nature while driving.

title: Beautiful view
review: This area was earlier called as Tiffin top and used to be the Garhwal regiment mess. Now there are log huts managed by the tourist department and if you don't mind staying not too near the centre then you can consider to stay here.

title: Tin - in - Top
review: Good scenic location........two very old churchs on the way from Lansdowne, online opens morning  & evening...

title: Breathtaking View
review: Its located about one Km from main Lansdowne town.It gives a nice view of Himalayas on a clear day although the place to stand and view is quite small.One can stay closeby in yhe log huts of Garwhal Mandal Vikas Nigam.

title: Also known as Suicide Point.
review: Nice view of snow covered mountains but for a very short period, as mostly you are surrounded by cloud and rain always.

title: Great views of peaks
review: The location has various view points from where the peaks  such as Nanda Devi and Neelkanth can be seen

title: Nice view
review: It is hardly a tourist attraction as the place was empty when we visited. It is located on the highest point in Lansdowne. Best time to visit is after rainfall during evening.

title: Scenic!
review: The point offers scenic views of mountains and the villages at the valley. However apart from the point you find nothing here. Can't spend more than an hour.

title: Nice View
review: Only go if it is a clear sky otherwise you will not be able to see anything.!! if no cloud is their you can see the splendid mountain range.....

title: Ideal place to see the deep valleys - big ravines and green, dense forests.
review: Visited this place in a group of 8 people, i would rate it as a fine place to just sit and relax. This is a protruding point of a hill slope so you'd get a feeling of being in air sometimes owing to the sudden gushes of wind and sporadic clouds hovering around.

title: nice view but no guaranty of clouds
review: nice place with beautiful scenic view. having Gharwal Vikas mandal guest house also there at this point, so one can also book that over internet if would like to stay on top of the hill & with scenic view.

title: A place you should must visit
review: This is situated on the top of the hill from entire view of Lansdowne is possible. You can see the curve of roads leading to Lansdown. The view of multiple layers of many mountains is a good attraction of this place.

title: decent place
review: decent place to visit...lots of scenic views and greenry. make sure that weather is clear for agood experience otherwise visibility is nill. but definitely a good place worth a visit if you are visiting lansdowne.

title: What a waste
review: I had heard so much about this place..went to see sunset there with my husband.. It was so disappointing. It has around 2 mtr radius..there was jus 1 more couple other than us and we were already feeling crowded. View from there is also average. You can skip it

title: Tip in Top point, Lansdowne.
review: This is one of the places on the itinerary of the Lansdowne visitors. It is located on a high location which can be reached either by a vehicle or on foot . On the way we also come across the other two points,viz, The St John's church and St. Mary's church. A viewing platform has been constructed by the lansdowne cantonment board from where one can view distant mountains overlooking a huge valley. Since there are no shops nearby hence one must carry drinking water  etc. by oneself. It is around three kilometres from the market. When I visited the place on 21-23 April,2013, several new wooden huts were being constructed there. The journey to the Tip in Top point from the market is good but once you reach the point you don't get very impressed. The place lacks cleanliness and has to seriously developed as an attractive tourist point.

title: Beautiful View
review: Tip-In-Top also known as Tiffin Top is situated in the ridge near St. Mary’s Church. This is a popular spot for visiting Lansdowne. From this spot, we can get view of the beautiful snow covered Himalayas and some parts of Tibet.

title: The Best views in Lansdowne
review: Again, fantastic views of the valley, you can even see the snow-capped himalayas including the Nanda Devi range. The walk to this place is outside the Tip-N-Top hotel, a GMVN managed govt hotel. You also need to shell out about INR 10 for parking. You can even go inside the GMVN if you want to enjoy some lunch.

title: Famous for beautiful view
review: This is a popular spot for visiting Lansdowne. From this spot, we can get view of the beautiful snow covered Himalayas and some parts of Tibet.

title: Amazing View.
review: The view from this point is simply amazing. You can see the whole valley from here and if the weather is clear you can even see the Himalayan Range. And the best way to reach here is by trek.

title: Tip N Top
review: The view of the Lansdowne Town is really great from this place. One of the few points to visit in Lansdowne.

title: View Point in Lansdowne
review: Probably highest point in lansdowne town for awsome views. Though we have to wait a lot due to clouds at that time. But view of hills from here is awsome. There is also Govt run guest house on the same point.

title: Magnificent View
review: Of all the lookout points of most hilly towns, the one at Lansdowne is a treat. Used to be called 'Tiffin Top', all these points are not called 'Tip n Top Point', god knows why & how the transformation happend! The point is small but gives an arched view of the valley ahead right uptil the Tibet border on days with clear skies. The place is a 4-5 km drive from town square.

title: Great point, even better approach road
review: Its high up a hill - steep but enjoyable 1 km walk through the woods. the effort is worth it - the views of the snow clad himalayas are awesome

title: Beautiful view from Tip & Top
review: Amazing look from this tip & top area. Lots of clouds, greenery & valley view. Good place to see & enjoyyyyyyy.....!!

title: In the Lap of Nature
review: A place where u'll feel being in lap of nature as clouds and mist will surround u from all sides. a place to be alone and in urself.where u can feel your inner soul ,power and spirituality of nature will bound you and you will love to extend some more time to the place ,the old british time architecture in the form of government owned wooden cottages and a tea in the park out side just loved it.

title: Figures in Lansdowne's 'top 5', but overall an average attraction
review: Lansdowne has few attractions to boast of, and one of these is 'Tip-in-Top Point'. About four kilometres uphill from the main town market, you shall also pass Lansdowne's two churches - St Joseph and St. Mary's - on your way to this point. A pretty building, St. Mary's Church was built in the earlier half of the nineteenth century. There is a nice view of the surrounding hills from near this Church too. 600 metres from here is Tip-in-Top Point, and the govt. tourist guest house is built right next to it, where you can enjoy a meal and tea. The views from Tip-in-Top point are expansive, and if you go early in the morning, the mountains are covered in a sea of clouds. But don't expect too much besides a nice view.

title: Mountain view
review: The view of the mountains and hills were fabulous. There could be some proper  resting arrangement at the point

title: Nice View of the mountain
review: It is the most famous point of Lansdowne, I went there with my friends. The route we took was a wrong one,so we had to walk extra mile,however we enjoyed the beauty of the forest. The red buras were really beutiful beside the road. The view from the Tip -in Top point was really breathtaking.

title: Paradise on Earth
review: Stay in GNVM and the view from this point is like Paradise on Earth.. it is one of the few places where you can see the sunrise and sunset at same point. also the sunrise view is super exciting..

title: Serene surroundings
review: Simply great.  This point is simply awesome. You can see the beautiful gift of God through this point. Pine tree and leopard scene  tree are added beauty. Tree resort there is anotther USP

title: Decent view
review: On a clear day,and in the mornings,you can see quite the distance and the snow capped mountains can be spotted too.BUt a bit into the day and the glare from the sun really reduces your chance of a good vista.

title: cool n beautiful
review: it is very famous point of Lansdowne i went there twice

title: beautiful n calm
review: if anybody actually wants to enjoy this place then go to this place a little early because little view will be more clear n m sure serenity of this place will make u relieved from stress for long

title: Tip In Top, Lansdowne
review: One of most beautiful view point in Lansdowne, and you can say also that it is the only point in Lansdowne. Best time for visit is early morning and carry water bottle, because there is no shop to purchase anything. Located just behind GMVN guest house. It is a must watch place. Very calm & cool spot in Lansdowne.

title: excellent view
review: as i reached the place, i was fascinated by the view of the valleys and mountains.The loud sound of chirping of birds,the fragrance of the trees and the never ending view of the mountains was outstanding.This place is highly recommended and i enjoyed going there.

title: A Good View Point
review: A very good place to have a majestic view of mighty Himalayas from Lansdowne.

title: Blue Pine ...Rocks
review: Lansdowne is a perfect place for those who wants to have a peaceful time with friends and family ....the weather is really nice , Morning and evenings are very chilled ..afternoons are hot ....Blue Pine is a great plays to enjoy the pleasent weather and good food ..........the staff is very courteus and I was shocked to see its not for tips ....

title: Nothing too great !!!
review: Just a nice view which is obstructed by overgrown bushes. Authorities need to take care of this till its too late.

title: Good Views but from very far
review: This place is very far from the Shivalik ranges so gives only rough views where you can only figure out the individual peaks like Mana peak, Choukhamaba Peaks.

title: Worth 10 minutes, nothing more
review: Most touristy place in lansdowne but good views. The GMVN guest house nearby also entertains public from outside for food which is a nuisance for guests staying in GMVN

title: Great View.
review: Tip-in-Top is the highest point of Lansdowne, and the view of the Joshimath's snow clad mountains from there is amazing. The pre-independence churches and bungalows are a must see.

title: Overrated
review: It is one of the overrated spots to see in Lansdowne. The view is not even scenic. One should got to Tarkeshwar temple for better views. Good for photography even.

title: Beautiful
review: Very beautiful and serene. I wish we had stayed at this GMVN property.

title: This is a point from where you can see snow covered Himalayas. Only good in Sunny day.
review: Its lonely and accessible only if you have your own vehicle...This is 3-4 kms from Main lansdowne. You must carry good resolution camera otherwise visiting here is a waste..

title: Nice place to see the Lansdowne
review: Very nice place but over hyped as Lansdowne has not so much attractive places to visit.

title: Beautiful view from top of Lansdowne
review: As name suggests it is at the top most tip of Lansdowne. Again, nothing much to do, you can spend just half an hour if you are here just to visit a point in hill station for capturing pics to post on facebook (as many of us do when we are at hill stations). Otherwise you can stay there for hours if you need solitude or looking forward for a vacation doing nothing and just unwinding your self after spending months in the hectic corporate environment. Or managing your business. For the later, better option shall be to book the GMVN cottages at Tip-in-Top as it is the nearest accommodation available adjacent to this point.

title: just amazing...
review: Go to that point... and there is a cliff on the left hand side of the point.

title: Good View
review: Nothing out of the world, but worth the drive up to the point to get a clear view of the valley and beyond.

title: Great views
review: You can have a very good view of mountains from there. Old lords used to view movements from there. There are stones on left, you can sit and enjoy there.

title: Nice scenic point
review: It is one of the top most points in Lansdowne and good for taking nice pictures. We spend about 30-40 minutes in the place, but I am sure with the new construction coming around it will turn more commerical by next year

title: Popularly know as Tiffin Top
review: Nothing much here except a good view. The GNVM restaurant and hotel is under renovation, so all we could have was a cup of tea.

title: A simple, clean and quite place
review: The cloud & fog was so heavy that i missed the chance to see the Himalayan peaks but the excitement of being at the top of hill was not something you can imagine unless experienced.

title: MAGICAL to say the least. :)
review: Best place to be in if you are looking for the peace outside the city hustle and bustle. Perfect place. :)

title: high point
review: location is the key, great sight at great height. A must visit once you are in Lansdowne. Beautiful and scenic

title: Amazing place
review: Tip In Top is a location at Lansdowne-Uttarakhand. It is a point from where you can view mountain ranges. We went there in the month of August and were very lucky to be able to view the beauty of rain washed lush green valley as well as mountain ranges covered with thin clouds. The scenery cannot be described in words and one has to experience it!! I could not stop clicking the various moods of the mother nature as it changed from little sunny to misty cool to a view where you see only some part of the ranges bathed in bright Sun while the rest coverd with thick cover of clouds time just flies here and you still do not have enough of it!!!

title: Gross disappointment.
review: Nature at its best but despite God being so kind to this place man has kept it in shambles. Authorities, particularly GMVN need to awaken and pull up

title: not much to do
review: It is just anothe view areaand it must have a restoraunt type area to enjoy snacks n view
